title: Neil Gaiman on religious controversy, Bohemian Rhapsody and his open marriage
text:
Neil Gaiman has been upsetting Christians. The award-winning author of The Sandman, Coraline and American Gods caused a stir earlier this year with the release of his self-directed TV adaptation of Good Omens, the well-loved 1990 novel he co-wrote with the late Terry Pratchett. It’s about the birth of the Antichrist and the end of the world, a prospect which so appals an angel (Michael Sheen) and a demon (David Tennant) who have been enjoying life on Earth since the Creation that they join forces to try to thwart Armageddon.

That special relationship went down so badly in the US that a 20,000-strong petition was sent to Netflix to cancel the series – and the streaming giant agreed not to make...
description: Neil Gaiman has been upsetting Christians.
